intro: Xanthisma scabrellum, commonly known as the rough xanthisma, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and limited water availability. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptations to harsh environments.
